title: Lake Griffin State Park
text:
Lake Griffin State Park is a <a href="Florida%20State%20Parks">Florida State Park</a> located two miles (3 km) north of <a href="Leesburg%2C%20Florida">Leesburg</a>, in <a href="Fruitland%20Park">Fruitland Park</a> and south of <a href="Ocala%2C%20Florida">Ocala</a> on <a href="U.S.%20Highway%20441%20%28Florida%29">U.S. Highway 441</a>. It is home to one of the state's largest <a href="live%20oak">live oak</a> trees. The park is unique in connecting to Lake Griffin, the <a href="Ocklawaha%20River">Ocklawaha River</a> and thence to the <a href="Harris%20Chain%20of%20Lakes">Harris Chain of Lakes</a>, and is made up of 577.63 acres (2.33758 km2) of <a href="swampland">swampland</a> and <a href="hardwood">hardwood</a> upland.
Activities include boating and canoeing, kayaking, hiking, fishing, camping, and wildlife viewing. Among the wildlife of the park are <a href="osprey">osprey</a>, <a href="bald%20eagle">bald eagle</a>, <a href="Great%20blue%20heron">blue heron</a>, <a href="anhinga">anhinga</a>, <a href="ibis">ibis</a>, <a href="American%20alligator">American alligator</a>, and <a href="North%20American%20river%20otter">river otter</a>.
Amenities include a full-facility campground, a half-mile nature trail, a boat ramp that provides access to the <a href="Dead%20River%20%28Lake%20County%2C%20Florida%29">Dead River</a>, and a playground for small children as well as kayak and canoe rentals, a forty site campground, and a picnic area. The park is open from 8:00 am until sundown year-round.
